comment.author: 37653910@N08
comment._content: How do you get an unofficial post office? Surely to have had mail delivered you would have to be official?

comment.author: 77608117@N06
comment._content: delighted to find this picture.. this hotel was in our family after Hanlons owned it..

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77608117@N06] It's great to connect people with thier past. Any chance your family has a photograph of the hotel in the time your family owned it?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/37653910@N08] I think that the 'unofficial Post Office' means that any mail for settlers in that area was dropped off at the hotel for them to collect. Things were pretty rough and ready in early Queensland!

comment.author: 85277858@N03
comment._content: Does anyone have information on the actual Yatala Hotel that used to be run by Stan and Eileen Pope before it was demolished?

comment.author: 75411485@N08
comment._content: hdl.handle.net/10462/deriv/85860 Please see the photo in the link above and the description of the photograph. It does not mention Stan and Eileen Pope, but it might be of interest.
